text: I played so much Turok 1 back in the day, even a decade or so after not playing the game I can go back and still have a blast and still remember most of the secrets. Pump action shotgun for life. I loved the music in the game. Too bad Turok 2 didn't hold up quite as well. It had some nice music, but honestly I think the game was a bit too much for the N64 to handle. Fun, but choppy, and the levels just never seemed to end. The weapons were amazing though.Â

author: daneofurexistence

text:
I love listening to all the music you've chosen for this list. I started listening to the entire series a few weeks ago, and I'm already at 614. Only 1025 left to go to catch up to today's update.Â 

Your list has been so helpful getting me through my endless hours of homework everyday, and it has made me aware of so many new game series that I had never realized existed or excepted. Thank you for making this list and keeping it going for over seven(!) years. You really give video games the justice they deserve as an art form.

If I may make some suggestions, if you haven't put them in your list already:

- Dragon Quest IX: Boss Fight, Final Boss Fight, Flying in the Starflight Express

- Bravely Default: Ancheim, Florem, Hartschild, Enemy Dungeon Theme, Visitor, Signs of an Enemy Invasion, Asterisk Battle Theme, Crystal Boss Battle Theme

- Bowser's Inside Story: Final Boss Theme

- Dream Team: Dream Battle Theme, Boss Battle Theme

Again, these are just suggestions, but please keep them in mind.

author: Bill A

text: Today's upload brought to you by SupraDarky's nostalgia. Easily the most tribal theme in the list so far. Darren Mitchell expertly composed a soundtrack consisting of mostly percussions and a couple synths (and some random roars that remind me of anything but a dinosaur) and make it sound memorable. This game is actually one of my favorite FPS of all time, I loved the setting, atmosphere, gameplay (the series having some of the most memorable weapons ever) and also had way too much fun playing with some of the cheats like Big Heads or Tiny Enemies. It's one of those cases where I know the sequel is better in almost every way, but my heart's with the original.
author: SupraDarky

author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: Yes, I had been waiting for you to grace the list with anything Turok! I was personally hoping for Port of Adia from Turok 2 but hey, this works too. This is a series that needs to be revisited, and not in the way the 2008 game handled it. It is because of that game that Turok is dead >:( There needs to be a resurgence of platform based FPS games, instead of Rehashed Linear Advanced Military Simulator 2050 every year.
